page.title: 17R.C. CHURCH,VENTNOR.
page.content: Richard Smith provided the money to build the Church of Our Lady and St. Wilfred which was completed in 1872. It was built by Dan Day of Bonchurch. It seats approx. 200 people and about 136 people attend the two services on a Sunday. The priest, Father Richard Davey is also responsible for St. Joseph's Church, Niton, and his parish extends 8 miles to the west and 4 miles to the north. The organist Mrs. Kenny is 93 years old and has been organist for 60 years. The church has no Sunday School but St. Wilfred's Primary School belongs to it and they share a hall. There is a youth group of 16. The church raises money through collections, covenants, fetes and coffee mornings. It sends Â£1,000 a year to charities.
